category.name: wcf.user
category.item: Two-Factor Authentication
Two-Factor Authentication helps protecting your account, as you will be asked a one time code after each login. You need Google Authenticator to use Two-Factor Authentication.
Two-Factor Code
The given code is invalid.
The given code was already used. For security reasons a single code may not be used more than once. Please wait until a new code was generated.
Enter the code that is displayed on your phone to change Two-Factor Authentication settings.
The emergency code was successfully used and Two-Factor Authentication was disabled.
Your account is protected with Two-Factor authentication. You need the current code to proceed.
Enter the code that is displayed on your phone to proceed.
Two-Factor Secret
Scan the QR code or enter the displayed Secret into your Google Authenticator. To activate Two-Factor Authentication you need to enter the code that displayed on your phone into the input below.

Two-Factor Authentication was successfully enabled. Your emergency code is: {$twofaEmergency}. Keep your emergency code in a safe place as you will need it to disable Two-Factor Authentication in case your Phone stops working or gets lost.
Disable Two-Factor Authentication
Two-Factor Authentication was successfully disabled.

category.name: wcf.acp.option
category.item: Two-Factor Authentication
Administration only
Activates Two-Factor Authentication in Administration Control Panel only.
Require activation for Administators
Denies access to the Administration Control Panel if the account is not protected with Two-Factor Authentication.
Remember Period
Period, in which the user will not be asked again. [time in days]
